medical_history.chief_complaint: Right upper quadrant pain for 2 days, worsening.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient presents with right upper quadrant pain that began 2 days ago and has been worsening. The pain is described as constant and radiates to the right flank and back. Patient has experienced some nausea. No fevers, chills, vomiting, changes in bowel function or urinary symptoms noted. There may be some relation to food, but patient has taken minimal oral intake since the pain began.
